title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 1. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Podiatrists Registration Board
text_raw:
1. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Podiatrists Registration Board 

Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 2023. 

(2) The bye-law comes into operation on the 21st day of March 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) bye-law may cited podiatrist registration board approved qualification bye-law 2023 (2) bye-law come operation 21st day march 2023

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: In the bye-law –
text_raw:
2. 

In the bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (no.27 of 
2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“the Register” means the register of the Podiatrists Registration Board 
established under section 36(1)(a) of the Act.
text_norm: 2 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no.27 2005) (as amended time time) register mean register podiatrist registration board established section 36(1)(a) act

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 3. The Podiatrists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(a)
text_raw:
3. The Podiatrists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(a) 
of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to the 
standard of proficiency required for registration in the Register: 

(1) Bachelor of Science (Podiatric Medicine), National University of 

Ireland Galway. 

The Minister for Health approves the making of this bye-law. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Health, 

16 January, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th March, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [120] 3 

Given under the seal of Podiatrists Registration Board 
 21 March 2023 

CATHERINE CLUNE MULVANEY, 
 Chairperson, Podiatrists Registration Board 

KIERON O’LEARY 

 Member, Podiatrists Registration Board 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [120]

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Podiatrists Registration Board as attesting to the standard of 
proficiency required for registration with the Podiatrists Registration Board.
